Member Function Documentation

static create ( $  sName = null,
array $  arOptions = array() 
) [static]

Constructs and returns a jQuery widget

The options passed in are dynamically added to the options array and will be accessible and modifiable as normal (.i.e. $this->theme, $this->baseUrl, etc.)

Parameters:
array $arOptions The options for the widget
string $sClass The class of the calling object if different
Returns:
CPSjqGridWidget

Definition at line 90 of file CPSMcDropdownWidget.php.

    {
        //  Get the options...      
        $_arOptions = ( null != $arOptions ) ? $arOptions : $this->makePublicOptions();
        
        //  Jam something in front of options?
        if ( null != $sInsertBeforeOptions )
        {
            $_sOptions = $sInsertBeforeOptions;
            if ( ! empty( $_arOptions ) ) $_sOptions .= ", {$_arOptions}";
            $_arOptions = $_sOptions;
        }

        $this->script =<<<CODE
jQuery('#{$this->target}').mcDropdown('#{$this->targetMenu}',{$_arOptions});
CODE;

        return $this->script;
    }

registerClientScripts ( $  bLocateScript = false  ) 

Registers the needed CSS and JavaScript.

Parameters:
boolean If true, system will try to find jquery plugins based on the pattern jquery.<plugin-name[.min].js
Returns:
CClientScript The current app's ClientScript object

Reimplemented from CPSjqUIWrapper.

Definition at line 62 of file CPSMcDropdownWidget.php.

    {
        //  Daddy...
        $this->autoRegister = false;
        parent::registerClientScripts( $bLocateScript );
        
        //  Reset the baseUrl for our own scripts
        $this->baseUrl = $this->extLibUrl . self::PS_EXTERNAL_PATH;
    
        $this->pushScriptFile( "{$this->baseUrl}/lib/jquery.bgiframe.js" );
        $this->pushScriptFile( "{$this->baseUrl}/lib/jquery.mcdropdown.min.js" );
        PS::_rcf( "{$this->baseUrl}/css/jquery.mcdropdown.min.css" );
        
        //  And register ours...
        $this->registerWidgetScript();
        
        return PS::_cs();
    }
